Module mesakit.graph.core
Package com.telenav.mesakit.graph.specifications.common.vertex.store

Class VertexStore

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.loading.Unloadable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.primitive.collections.CompressibleCollection, com.telenav.kivakit.validation.Validatable, AttributeStore, Iterable<Vertex>
public class VertexStore extends NodeStore<Vertex>
Store of Vertex information, including edge connectivity (in and out edges, as stored in the ConnectivityStore associated with this store) and clip state.

A vertex store has two phases. In the first phase, information is added to temporary data structures in the ConnectivityStore that track one-way in, one-way out and two-way edges as they are added to the store. In the second phase, onCommit() is called and this temporary information is used to create Vertex objects and add them to the vertex store.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
VertexAttributes

    • gradeSeparate

      public void gradeSeparate​(Vertex originalVertex, GradeSeparation grade, EdgeSet edgesAtGrade)
      Creates a new grade separated vertex with a perturbed location, so it doesn't precisely overlap any other grade-separated vertex. This method is complex and expensive, but it occurs rarely (mainly at freeway interchanges, bridges and overpasses) so optimization is not a concern. Note that the original vertex will eventually be abandoned (left unconnected to anything) once the process of grade separating the vertex is complete (after separating n levels of vertexes).
      Parameters:
      originalVertex - The vertex to grade-separate
      grade - The grade separation level for the new vertex
      edgesAtGrade - The edges at the given grade to connect to the new vertex

    • gradeSeparateConnectEdgesToNewVertex

      public void gradeSeparateConnectEdgesToNewVertex​(Vertex newVertex, Vertex originalVertex, EdgeSet edgesAtGrade)
      Connects the grade-separated edges from the original vertex to the new vertex
      Parameters:
      newVertex - The new vertex to connect
      originalVertex - The original un-separated vertex
      edgesAtGrade - The set of edges at the grade of the new vertex

    • gradeSeparatePerturbVertexLocation

      public void gradeSeparatePerturbVertexLocation​(Vertex vertex, Vertex originalVertex, GradeSeparation grade, EdgeSet edgesAtGrade)
      Alters the location of a new vertex slightly, so it will not precisely overlap any other grade-separated vertex.
      Parameters:
      vertex - The new vertex to perturb
      originalVertex - The original un-separated vertex
      grade - - The grade of the new vertex
      edgesAtGrade - - The edges at the given grade

    • loadVertexTags

      public void loadVertexTags​(PbfDataSource data, PbfTagFilter filter)
      Once vertexes have been created, a pass is made through the data loading vertex tags. This is a relatively quick process, but it's not possible to do until vertexes have been identified as loading all node tags into memory might be problematic for some regions.

    • temporaryAddVertexes

      public void temporaryAddVertexes​(Edge edge)
      Connects the given edge to the graph, by adding vertexes to it and storing edge connectivity information.

      For both the "from" vertex and the "to" vertex of the given edge:

      • A mapping is added from node identifier -> location
      • An index is created for the vertex (this will also serve as the vertex identifier)
      • A mapping is added from node identifier -> index and from index -> node identifier
      • A mapping is added from index -> location
      Then, if the edge is a HeavyWeightEdge:
      • A Vertex is created with the index as its VertexIdentifier
      • The vertex Location is added to the Vertex
      • The Vertex is added to the (heavyweight) edge
      Finally, the edge and its "from" and "to" vertex identifiers are then added to the ConnectivityStore via ConnectivityStore.temporaryConnect(Edge, int, int)

    • temporaryRemove

      public void temporaryRemove​(Edge edge)
      Removes the given edge from this store by detaching the "from" and "to" vertexes
